titleStmt.title: [Military Order] 1827 May 19, [to] Gen[era]l John Coffee / Andrew Jackson : a machine readable transcription of an image
titleStmt.author: Jackson, Andrew

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the University of Memphis Libraries, Special Collections Department, Ned R. McWherter Library, Memphis, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the University of Memphis Libraries, 126 Ned R. McWherter Library, The University of Memphis, Memphis, TN 38152-6500.

bibl.title: [Military Order] 1827 May 19, [to] Gen[era]l John Coffee / Andrew Jackson
bibl.author: Jackson, Andrew
bibl.note: This document is a military order from Andrew Jackson allowing General John Coffee to deliver to Edmund Winston a bond due by Colonel Anthony Winston for the sum one thousand, sixty six dollars and two third cents.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.opener:
Genl General John Coffee
Mr Winston
Deliver the note over to Anthony Winston
Col. Colonel Winston
div.p:
Genl General Coffee will deliver unto Mr Edmond Winston a bond due by
Colo. Colonel Anthony Winston on the first day of March 1827 for the sum of one thousand sixty six dollars sixty six & two third cents he having indetted indebted me for the sum of nine hundred forty one dollars nineteen & a half cents in the purchase of the tract of land sold to William Word & by sum sold to me & given me less my due bill for one hundred twenty five dollars & nineteen & a half cents
